title: Microservices Architecture
description: Architectural pattern where an app is a collection of loosely coupled services.
fullDescription: Microservices is an architectural style that structures an application as a collection of services that are highly maintainable and testable, loosely coupled, independently deployable, organized around business capabilities, and owned by a small team. It is the evolution of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).
diagram:
graph TD
  GW[API Gateway] --> S1[User Service]
  GW --> S2[Order Service]
  GW --> S3[Payment Service]
  S1 --> DB1[(Postgres)]
  S2 --> DB2[(MongoDB)]
  S3 --> DB3[(Redis)]
bestPractices: Design for failure: implement circuit breakers.
Use distributed tracing (e.g., Jaeger) for observability.
Maintain data sovereignty: one database per service.

title: React Hooks
description: Functions that let you hook into React state and lifecycle.
fullDescription: Hooks are a relatively new addition in React 16.8. They let you use state and other React features without writing a class. They provide a more direct way to use the React features you already know â€” props, state, context, refs, and lifecycle.
bestPractices: Only call Hooks at the top level.
Only call Hooks from React function components or custom Hooks.
